reference.scope: VARIANTS DBH DEFICIENCY MET-101; GLU-114 AND ASN-345

comment.text: Catecholamine biosynthesis; (R)-noradrenaline biosynthesis; (R)-noradrenaline from dopamine: step 1/1.
Homotetramer; composed of two disulfide-linked dimers.
Activity is enhanced by nerve growth factor (in superior cervical ganglia and adrenal medulla). Trans-synaptic stimulation with reserpine, acetylcholine and glucocorticoids.
Proteolytic cleavage after the membrane-anchor leads to the release of the soluble form.
There are two main alleles of DBH: DBH-A with Ala-318 and DBH-B with Ser-318 (PubMed:10490716, PubMed:10391209, PubMed:10391210).

disease.name: Dopamine beta-hydroxylase deficiency
disease.description: Characterized by profound deficits in autonomic and cardiovascular function, but apparently only subtle signs, if any, of central nervous system dysfunction.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
Belongs to the copper type II ascorbate-dependent monooxygenase family.

property.value: P:regulation of extrinsic apoptotic signaling pathway

feature.description: Helical; Signal-anchor for type II membrane protein
